content: @Rob Hausam - any progress with GF#13869?
Melva and I just talked about that one today. I'll take it on to go through and look at CP and plan to have something concrete that we can look at on the tracker issues call on Monday.

GF#13869 posits that we mine core principles for content for FHIR. I've worked on this, and we've had a lot of calls for this. @Rob Hausam @Robert McClure @Lloyd McKenzie can we close this one as done now?

I really suspect we've gleaned all that we need at this point, so I'm inclined (strongly) to say yes on closing this one. I don't know for sure if any of us have actually reviewed it again as thoroughly as we thought we wanted to, but practically I think we probably are done.

In theory, I think we should do more. In practice, I can't imagine having time to do anything with it for another 4-5 months - and it's entirely likely even then it would fall towards the bottom of the stack. If someone finds the motivation and wants to do more, they certainly can, but I'm fine with closing the item

ok great. that means that the only open task related to terminology content is to update the shareableValueset profile. I presume it should be based on VSD recommendations? Other than that... some cosmetic changes to the terminology module page.
Yes, that sounds right. Should base the profile on VSD recommendations. I can work on the terminology module and other things - once I get through some of the SNOMED stuff for this week in Vancouver.
